intro: Pinalia annapurnensis, commonly known as the Annapurna pinalia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of Nepal. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
